page.title: 01NORTH HALF OF CASTLE CLIFF
page.content: An important area for tourism the headland has scenic value as it is 2-300 ft high cliffs at the top as well as being the site of a 12th Centrury castle (last used in 1745). The headland us maintained as parkland and gardens where possible and has some tree cover and affords good views of the area. North bay has a popular beach and the headland can be reached by a wastal drive around the bay and base of the cliffs. The extreme south west corner is built up, mainly rows of terraced houses of which a large number are hotels, guesthouses, flats and restaurants. Most permanent residents are entering to the needs of the tourist as there are also pubs abd a variety of shops. A large fire station. Some light engineering. Also further inland are some residential areas. Generally though the headland
